intro: Sideritis suffruticosa, commonly known as Greek oregano, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are aromatic and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Sideritis suffruticosa is also valued in culinary applications, particularly in Mediterranean cuisines.
